intro: Erysimum lanceolatum subsp. helveticum, commonly known as the Swiss wallflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Alpine regions of Europe. It features upright, branched stems that are often covered in a fine layer of white down. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with four petals, typically arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This species is well adapted to rocky and sunny environments, making it a common sight in alpine meadows and mountainous areas.
